intro: Stigmaphyllon lindenianum var. nicaraguense, commonly known as the Nicaraguan stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments, often in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
